content: अभिधानं {@--1@} Telling, mentioning, speaking, naming, denotation; एतावतामर्थानामिदमभिधानं <ls>Nir.</ls>; गोशब्दस्यं वाहिकार्थाभिधानं <ls>S. D.</ls> {@--2@} (In <ab>gram.</ab>) Asserting or predicating something of another, as the subject of an assertion, (which then can be put in the <ab>nom.</ab> case only); predication, assertion; See <ls>P. II. 3. 2</ls> <ls>Sk.</ls> {@--3@} A name, appellation, title, designation; अभिधानं तु पश्चात्तस्याहमश्रौषं <ls>K. 32</ls>; तवाभिधानाद् व्यथते नताननः <ls>Ki. 1. 24</ls>; (at the end of <ab>comp.</ab>) called, named; ऋणाभिधानाद् बंधनात् <ls>R. 3. 20.</ls> {@--4@} An expression, word. {@--5@} Speech, discourse. {@--6@} A dictionary, vocabulary (of words), lexicon (in these last {4} senses said to be also {%<ab>m.</ab>%})
